title: Prima facie evidence by third-party documents
context: ยง490:1-307 Prima facie evidence by third-party documents. A document in due form purporting to be a bill of lading, policy or certificate of insurance, official weigher&rsquo;s or inspector&rsquo;s certificate, consular invoice, or any other document authorized or required by the contract to be issued by a third party is prima facie evidence of its own authenticity and genuineness and of the facts stated in the document by the third party. [L 2004, c 162, pt of ยง1]
